articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Kate, the Princess of Wales, has apologized for “confusion” caused by her editing of a family photo released by the palace.
articles.title: Princess Kate says sorry for manipulated family photo, saying she was experimenting with editing

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Palestinians began fasting for Ramadan on Monday as the Muslim holy month arrived with cease-fire talks at a standstill, hunger worsening across the Gaza Strip and no end in sight to the five-month-old war between Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: Palestinians in Gaza begin Ramadan with hunger worsening and no end in sight to the Israel-Hamas war

articles.author: JAKE COYLE
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — “Oppenheimer,” a solemn three-hour biopic that became an unlikely billion-dollar box-office sensation, was crowned best picture at a 96th Academy Awards that doubled as a coronation for Christopher Nolan.
articles.title: 'Oppenheimer' crowned best picture at an Academy Awards shadowed by war

articles.author: ALEX BABENKO, HANNA ARHIROVA, SUSIE BLANN and LORI HINNANT
articles.description: SLOVIANSK, Ukraine (AP) — One Ukrainian brigade had defended the same block of industrial buildings for months without a break. Another had been in Avdiivka for nearly the entire two years of the war, bone-tired but with no replacements to relieve them.
articles.title: Exhaustion, dwindling reserves and a commander who disappeared: How Ukraine lost Avdiivka to Russia

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Jack Lobel is a college sophomore who will be voting in his first presidential election this fall, casting a ballot for Joe Biden. At 19, he's six-plus decades Biden's junior, which isn't lost on him.
articles.title: Youth activist groups jointly endorse Biden. They say his achievements matter more than his age

articles.author: KIMBERLEE KRUESI
articles.description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — In Republican-led states across the U.S., conservative legislators are refusing to reevaluate abortion bans — even as doctors and patients insist the laws’ exceptions are dangerously unclear, resulting in denied treatment to some pregnant women in need.
articles.title: GOP lawmakers resist calls to tweak abortion bans. Some say they'll clarify the laws' few exceptions

articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Kate, the Princess of Wales, has apologized for “confusion” caused by her editing of a family photo released by the palace.
articles.title: Princess Kate says sorry for manipulated family photo, saying she was experimenting with editing

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Officials saw the crescent moon Sunday night in Saudi Arabia, home to the holiest sites in Islam, marking the start of the holy fasting month of Ramadan for many of the world's 1.8 billion Muslims.
articles.title: Muslims spot Ramadan crescent moon in Saudi Arabia, meaning month of fasting starts Monday for many

articles.author: ROBERT BADENDIECK and EMRAH GUREL
articles.description: ISTANBUL (AP) — In the heart of Istanbul, on top of the towering minarets that dot the city’s skyline, 68-year-old Kahraman Yildiz toils away at a craft that has illuminated the Muslim holy month of Ramadan for generations.
articles.title: A Turkish artisan has kept the Istanbul skyline lit during Ramadan for decades. He may be the last

articles.author: BARRY HATTON
articles.description: LISBON, Portugal (AP) — Portugal’s political future is hanging in the balance after a general election Sunday, with two moderate mainstream parties closely contesting the race and set to wait weeks for a decision on the winner after an unprecedented surge in support for a populist party that finished third.
articles.title: Portugal is in suspense after an election produces no clear winner and a surging populist party
